author: Jessica Bursztynsky
title: Researchers find e-cigarettes cause lung cancer in mice in first study tying vaping to cancer
description: How carcinogenic e-cigarette use is for humans "may not be known for a decade," but the study is the first to link vaping nicotine to cancer
content:
E-cigarette vapor causes lung cancer and potentially bladder cancer in mice, damaging their DNA and leading researchers at New York University to conclude that vaping is likely "very harmful" to humans as well.
